dict.string: THE GLOW OF THE ETERNAL STAR
Hero: "Hey friend! Will you help me explore this strange planet?"
“I'll let you pass if you tell me a funny word!”
“Not. Funny. At. All. Now I am angry...”
“You won't like me when I'm angry!”
“I'll only let you pass if you hand over all your MoonRocks!”
“Wow, thanks! This is just what I needed!”
“You don't have any MoonRocks? Well I don't have any patience!”
“Umm... let me guess, you want something?”
“That's right. I am looking for a mysterious relic with the inscription THE ETERNAL STAR. Do you have such a relic?”
“Please go right ahead, there is something of greater value if you continue further.”
“This isn't it. This is an ETERNAL FAILURE!”
“I'm afraid you cannot pass, you'll be stuck here forever.”
“What will it take to let me pass?”
“I'm not like the other aliens. How about your least valuable item?”
“Yeah... this looks cheap. That's just my style.”
“Yes! I can see something in the distance!”
“I wanted something cheap... but instead you played a cheap trick!”
“Can I pass? I just need to go a little further...”
“You can pass, but only if you can answer my tricky problem!”
“Here's the problem... if I give you a group of three strings, can you tell me if the third string is a valid shuffle of the first two?”
“A valid shuffle combines two strings together where the left-to-right order of the characters in both strings is maintained.”
“For example, if I give you (“ab”, “cd”, “cabd”), then “cabd” is a valid shuffle because characters “ab” and “cd” still occur in the same order.”
“However, if I give you ("ab", "cd", “bacd”), then “bacd” IS NOT a valid shuffle because characters “ab” don't occur in the same order.”
“Alright, I can do it. Give me a group of strings!”
Hero: "Hey friend! Will you help me explore this strange planet?"
"Hello, little robot. What brings you to my planet?"
"That's fine, but before I can let you look for treasure, I need any items you have from the planet Glinda."
"I can't trust you. I'm calling the reinforcements!"
"I've been looking for an ancient item. The oldest artifact from the planet Cunia."
"Can I take a look at the oldest item you have from Cunia?"
"Wow. Very interesting. Thanks for letting me see this."
"Now, as you requested, you may pass."
“Are you sure this is the oldest thing you have? What's that sticking out of your compartment?"
"Uhh... I don't know what you're talking about..."
"Something is fishy. I am going to keep you here until further notice."
"I'm doing alright, but I could use some help. They've asked me to step up security along this path."
"I guess I could help. What do you need?"
"I'm trying to crack a code that is being used by interplanetary pirates."
"They've been encrypting their messages using a number between 0 and 255."
"I'm just not sure which number it is... but I do know this encrypted message means "udacity"!"
“Heh. Yeah, I'm pretty good with encryption. Not because I'm a pirate or anything..."
“Aww man... it isn't working. Wait a minute!"
“How do I know you're not a pirate?!?"
"I need a quick way to report the rarity of items."
"I won't take your items, but could you show me how to quickly report the rarity of items?"
"If it gets me closer to some treasure, then why not? Let me think..."
"That's awesome! I really like that approach.
"This is going to cause seriously delays."
"I'm sorry. I can't let you pass until I figure this out."
“Since you know so much about rarity... could you quickly determine if one item is more valuable than another?"
"And I don't just mean by an item's value. An item should be more valuable if it is more rare than another item."
"But... if they have the same rarity, then compare their base values."
“You're right. I would have never thought of that!"
"Yeah, it is pretty elegant when you think about it."
"This is so great. Please go ahead, I'm sorry for the delay!"
“That won't work. I've tried it already and it failed."
"Until I figure this out, I can't let you pass. Those are direct orders!"
"Ooo... a traveler. I could use your help."
"I'm having trouble reading this list of items. Some of them need to be banned from this planet."
"Could you look through the list and tell me items that mention a "laser" and are less than 30 carbon years old?"
"There is a recall on such items, and I need to get rid of them."
"Hmm... I'm not sure about this. I think I need a second opinion."
"I'll have another alien handle my watch. You'll need to wait here."
"I think I have something that could help you."
"It is a list of planets with information about items detected on their surface."
"I'll let you have it if you tell me the planet that has the most intriguing items."
“Interesting. Maybe I'll plan my next visit there."
"That isn't what the last robot told me."
"I think I'll have you wait here until someone comes along and gives us another opinion."
"Please tell me you're the last alien on this path."
"You've got it. And I will let you pass if you can answer my question."
“If you take the names of all the items in your inventory... what is the most common character?"
